AXl5J0rWiMSOS_hXZQNrFw.text: We were running out of time and got take out.  They prepared the sandwiches and salad in 10 minutes.  The panini and salads were very tasty.  Finding take out in the Grassmarket area was very hard.  The coffee mill had takeout containers and plastic utensils .

yahYf3KMeSpM8OvfFah_vw.text: Fast friendly service, food was fabulous, tea was great. Relaxed atmosphere. Not a lot of tourist just regular people enjoying great food and drink.

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Great food, fast friendly service. Cafe was not too touristy l, just normal people enjoying a relaxed environment!

X7mMLBy_9iShBuWGCh5hJA.text: Very sweet little coffee shop and cafe.  My latte was delicious.  The barista was friendly and helpful. Perfect little neighborhood coffee stop!

R_sDFyUT16vgF62Y7-jifA.text: The coffee was quite good but the service was very slow and breakfast only mediocre.  The toast was just hamburger buns...which was disappointing.  The eggs were served well.  Overall unimpressed

dAt2_5xo_M42wBDBCwSHOg.text: Perfect breakfast comfort food. Funny friendly staff and really good latte. A great way to fortify for a day of sightseeing.

uLvC5ndZXSZrpKNWTJNN0g.text: After last night's whiskey binge, my dad and I wanted hot, nourishing comfort food for breakfast. Unfortunately in the Grassmarket area that seems to be a challenge.  In our escalating panic and hunger we found only niche eateries: chain coffeeshops where students sit for seven hours drinking lattes, obscure looking cafes selling seventy kinds of coffee and three types of cold quickbreads, and a cake shop.  Coffee Mill saved us with their quiet, unpretentious atmosphere, great service, and big honking breakfasts: eggs, cheese, toast with generous amounts of jam, bacon, perfectly fried tomatoes, beans, steaming hot potato scones, fried mushrooms, and the morning paper. Getting up from the table was a challenge.   It's a shame more folks don't eat here.

dyL-XxkVBN55XUYHN3PAeQ.text: It's almost a surprise to find somewhere as unassuming and normal as the Coffee Mill on the West Port, which seems to be a hub for kitsch and quirky businesses.  Among the strip joints and second-hand bookshops, it's reassuring to know that there's somewhere nearby that just sells straightforward coffee and sandwiches.  Half of this shop is dedicated to take-away, half to sit-in tables.  It's always been quiet when I've been, making it an ideal spot to retire for a read of any recently purchased books.  The staff are always smily and friendly, almost to the point of excess, and there's something especially delicious about the coffee they sell. The food they do is basic - baked potatoes, filled rolls etc. - but makes a perfectly satisfying lunch.  All in all, there's not much more to say about the Coffee Mill.  There's nothing remarkable about it, but that's ok, some things don't need to be remarkable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Dd6hFpXoO1muZzTJKisGvQ.text: Friendly, bright little cafe on the West Port. We had coffees and a couple of paninis with salad, both of which were fresh, tasty and clearly carefully made (which is saying something, paninis are ubiquitous these days and often tasteless and slapped together). Really nice snack, we'll definitely be back when we're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

cd5rUYdEXjsk3Df0aIM8ZA.text: Such a friendly and welcoming place. The owners go out of their way to give you a great service. Had the full English breakfast which was the right size and delicious - not too much, not too little. Stop by for a great cup of coffee and warm service.

F0ZLo4uxgaiDoSky79ebIg.text: I was visiting Edinburgh with my family from California and we were trying to find a good and affordable place to eat since the exchange rate for Americans means we pay 1 and  1/2 more for everything. This place was perfect. The owner Gino was extremely hospitable and accommodating and the food was delicious with extremely reasonable prices. I highly recommend this place if you are visiting on a tight budget or if you just want good food with great service at a good price.

TE-GSg22nmn5Li154ieVEQ.text: Wandering on streets of Edinburgh, we found this place on yelp. Really good food and service. We ordered the vegetarian breakfast and chicken couscous. Both were delicious. Coffee and hot chocolate were really good too. Very nice place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

6P1bKSPRVaGn-bYPnem_UA.text: Prices reasonable for the area but not amazing Espresso was a bit oxidized and sour. Dont recommend Lasagna pretty good Smoked salmon scramble pretty good Reasonable seating space and good location Zero parking  Overall worth the visit but I wouldn't rate it orgasmic 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salmon scrambled eggs
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beef lasagna
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hair raising double espresso

So-xanOmweixNT83WuQ6zQ.text: Great little place for a quality breakfast. Wife ordered the scrambled eggs and salmon and I had the Full Scottish Breakfast. Really great food overall, and at a fantastic price. In fact the Scottish Breakfast is served at most restaurants for breakfast and this spot has it the cheapest we've seen so far. Short walk from most of the residences in the area. Would recommend it for anyone that likes a subtle experience in a nice little coffee shop.

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs and salmon
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Latte (top) and Cappuccino (bottom)
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scottish Breakfast

-C3fsewEWbr-ZyVGKEINQA.text: Small restaurant great for breakfast. The service was great we got seats right away, and then the waiter took our drink orders immediately. When our drinks were ready we ordered our meals and they were out in about ten minutes. The hostess and the waiter were very friendly during our entire stay.  I ordered the full Scottish Breakfast and everything was fine. It was my first time trying haggis and not knowing what to expect it tasted very good and was not too dry. The bacon and sausage was also good, nothing magical but tasty and juicy. Overall I would recommend the coffee mill to anyone looking for breakfast in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Full Scottish Breakfast

gkwJYhE9A-dHR1rD0T7_vQ.text: Had the Smoked Salmon bagel and tea. Lovely little spot and very attentive staff. Not fancy so it's perfect for a lite breakfast. A person in my party had the full Scottish Breakfast and loved the Haggis and Black Pudding. Cute decor and music.

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3G2oEgPxrJ82XvZJkCc9NQ.text: Good morning, Edinburgh!!  It's day 4 of our trip and we are on our own to explore Edinburgh.  We had tickets for the Castle at 9:30 and decided to yelp a place nearby for breakfast.  The Coffee Mill came up with decent reviews, and they had the Scottish Breakfast, too!    The menu had a little bit of everything, but since I knew we would be walking the Castle, I wanted a hearty breakfast and chose the English breakfast. Stephen chose the Scottish breakfast, which included blood pudding and haggis, which containing sheep's pluck (heart, liver and lungs) minced with onion, oatmeal, suet, spices, and salt, mixed with stock, traditionally encased in the animal's stomach though now often in an artificial casing instead.    The breakfast was very filling, and they even accepted Apple Pay!  Bellies full, we are off to visit the Edinburgh Castle

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scottish breakfast
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. English Breakfast in front, Scottish in back

PJ9EYioivZM896btbqI-zg.text: OMGosh!! The haggis morning rolls!   This place is great. It has absolutely become our staple for breakfast/brunch (we get up late).   The staff is wonderful. Very professional. Extremely friendly. Very welcoming. Even on their super busy Saturday morning, they're still super nice :)  And the woman from Latvia is not only super friendly but also has a great sense of humor :-D  They have delicious food, and I am completely hooked on their haggis morning roll (don't let its unassuming appearance trick you into thinking that it's not as amazing as it is). In fact, it's hard for me to review their other foods, which all seem good and well-priced, because of how hooked I've become on this roll. This is totally not like me- usually it's the bf who gets into the rut of ordering the same thing over and over again, but I'm telling you- the haggis morning roll is JUST THAT GOOD!!  Btw, don't let yourself get stuck in the mindgame that afflicts so many people, Americans in particular, when it comes to haggis. It's just tastes like spicy ground beef, and it's no worse than what we eat in hot dogs.  They have several drinks to choose from. And they have a short assortment of healthy smoothies to choose from- I've tried all 4 and they're all good.   Their fruit scones have something pink in them (cranberry? cherry?) in addition to the raisins and they are YUMMY as well. In fact, I often end my meal with the scone so that I have that as my parting and longest-lasting taste in my mouth. My only request would be for there to be an option to get some Devonshire cream for the scones, but currently they do already provide some spritz whipping cream for it.   Now, I'm just trying to figure out how to get some of these haggis morning rolls back across the pond with me :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

xF5frTxttmHNsXMgJARuAQ.text: My friend and I were in Edinburgh for the weekend and stopped for brunch at this restaurant. It was a perfect amount of food and I would recommend this place to others!

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Full British Breakfast (£7.95)
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu (September 2018)
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu (September 2018)

CFW0ABqebvjf-etkPzHOZg.text: I came on alone around noon, and got the full about breakfast and a coffee. Both were excellent. The ambiance is very laid back, with primarily acoustic/folk music, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall a great place for an informal, tasty breakfast.

tSqjaQ9LcSIuq4LtgXS08g.text: I'm an American teacher chaperoning a trip to Scotland. Let's just say the food included in the trip was rubbish as one would say here. So, finally when I get my one day to be free, I yelped good breakfast spots. Well, let me say the Coffee Mill is superb. I ordered the American breakfast and it came with scrambled eggs, cheese, I subbed the bacon for turkey sausage and toast with jam. The eggs were creamy, cheese grated fresh, turkey sausage had a hint of spice and smokey (my fav). I ordered a coffee with milk (the best coffee I've had in Scotland). I'm very happy I got to experience one good meal! I highly recommend this little cozy/quaint place.

rK1hi65ARObrDYfnXKcfbA.text: Great place to dash in for a decent breakfast. The cakes in the window also are very good. The service is spot on and friendly.

2Uu9qfqW3QTmH_PL7rnhkA.text: Dinner: Haggis. Breakfast: Scottish breakfast.  Both were delicious although the Haggis entree was very filling. The staff were very helpful, patient, and nice. Service was quick and attentive with the waitress checking in on me every now and then for water. They also have a good selection of cakes and baked goods. Coffee wasn't bad either so I definitely would recommend this location for your local Scottish fare.

Qk4Y2J_LxadU30TIBpM_Lw.text: This place is simple and quirky in a very good way. It's not too small nor large, just right. The atmosphere is really very positive and relaxed.  Staff is very friendly and fast paste. Some might think the American coffee is not strong enough, but for me it was just right and the scrambled eggs delicious.   Considering the location,  even the prices are right and you won't feel ripped off.  Will I be back? Yes, defo!  It's the perfect breakfast /lunch place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Coffee Mill - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

6ZmbxG_1ESX8qheGiT55mQ.text: Perfect little place with great food at the right price. Pictures that are posted accurately describe the location and food.   Scottish breakfast was on point

4tfdZMLdpbcmHCCLOPi3Jw.text: Stay away from the full breakfasts.  The coffee was good (cappuccino had good foam, though they do put hot chocolate mix on top) and the scone, too. But the fried eggs were smashed and cooked through, the tattie scones were flavorless pancakes, and the mushrooms rubbery and lacking flavor.

aGH8B8BkSs4Y9fI7iQ_M2w.text: Located on the edge of the grassmarket is the happiest server / breakfast worker ever. I believe his name is Gino. I haven't encountered someone so friendly at a breakfast place in so long! I have been a few times and my go to meal is the bacon/cheese/fried egg bagel. It's divine. It also comes with a side salad. It costs less than 5 too.   It's a medium size restaurant, with seating available for about twenty. It's typically busy on the weekends, especially if the Six Nations is on.   If you are looking for a typical Scottish breakfast, then this is your place. It's something your grandfather would make.....but better! Ha!   Overall - food is tasty, service is excellent and fast.

O0XbCzQjiwqjQhEiljEOpg.text: A nice, simple cafe on West Port, The Coffee Mill is nothing pretentious or fancy, but it serves good produce. We popped in for just some sweet treats and hot beverages, although the breakfast and lunch menu looks great. We had two hot chocolates, a latte, a tea, a scone, and a caramel slice. The scone got a tremendous thumbs up from my mother, so well done on that! She preferred the scone here to the one in Kilimanjaro, which is really saying something in my view!  Hot chocolates were nice, but could have been hotter, and the latte was good too. Staff very friendly and welcoming. It was nice to come in from the dreary day outside. I will be back to try lunch and/or breakfast. Recommended.

ac-0qr5-mjIIlrCahjGG-A.text: Nice little breakfast spot in the Grassmarket. Everyone is super friendly, and the food is delicious! They have all sorts of breakfast options for everyone's tastes. Our group got the salmon and eggs, an American breakfast, and a Scottish breakfast, and they were all phenomenal. The American breakfast isn't served with streaky bacon, but that was my only disappointment (It just seems like it's hard to find in this city.)

qhspfEMNOLCasppP_S34Yg.text: I just ducked in here for some takeaway coffees and was immediately depressed that I couldn't stay longer! The owner, a Mr. Gino, greeted me warmly and chatted while he took my order and then - in True Italian style - flirted outrageously while ringing me up. The place was busy but didn't feel crowded, lots of light and cheerful atmosphere.  My takeaway cup leaked a bit on the walk which was the only downside, so maybe cheap cups? Wouldn't be a problem if you stayed in to eat but a bit of a downer being on the go, I had to drink fast rather than enjoy. The cappuccino was great though!  Wish I could come back and have breakfast.

zB-xRxEB2b50B6eQSS-QFA.text: Awesome staff, great food, reasonably priced. I ate here both mornings I was in Edinburgh...I wish they were in LA.  I will make it a point to stop in the next time I'm out there.
